We were wondering how the top teams do auto aiming on the reef. Do you do it entirely using pose estimation or do you use other sensors (Time Of Flight, etc)?

Set position on elevator and limelight auto align

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T00:11:49.547Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495980,"topic_slug":"how-do-teams-do-auto-aim-alignment-for-this-game","display_username":"Chase Eid","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69000,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-do-teams-do-auto-aim-alignment-for-this-game/495980/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3559946,"name":"James Mou","username":"Hammyboi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hammyboi/{size}/254112_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T00:24:21.663Z","cooked":"

We use PathPlanner’s AutoBuilder to generate a path to the reef, using vision in pose estimation. However, it can’t generate paths to the reef if the robot is too close to it, so we also set up a PID controller to control X and Y coordinates of the robot for short paths.

4915 PathPlanner Auto Align Whitepaper CD-Media: Papers
I have made a short document (which I believe fits the definition of a whitepaper?) which talks about our (4915’s) implementation of an auto align system using pathplanner’s on the fly pathing! The document links to our code as well if you want to take a peak under the hood! Another team has successfully implemented a version of this system using this paper but I am happy to answer any questions anyone has! Any feedback on the paper would also be greatly appreciated!
